title: How to Add a Link Button to the Home Screen of an iPhone

steps.title: Open Safari on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Safari on your iPhone or iPad. It's a blue app with a compass icon on it. You can only create website icons in Safari . [1] X Research source If you use the Google Chrome app, Mozilla Firefox app, or another browser app, you may only be able to save website bookmarks in the app itself.

steps.title: Navigate to the website you want to save.
steps.content: Navigate to the website you want to save. Tap the search bar to use the search engine or enter a specific website.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This is the Share button. You can find this at the bottom of the screen. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Add to Home Screen.
steps.content: Tap Add to Home Screen . You may need to drag the pop-up menu up to see this option. A new window will open. By default, Safari will name the app as the website's header. If you want to change this, tap the title field, delete it, and enter a new one.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . This is in the top-right corner. The website will be added to your Home screen as an app. When you tap it, the link will open in Safari. Similar to moving other apps , you can tap and drag or delete these shortcuts. You can also bookmark a website directly in Safari.
